intro: Onosma concinna, commonly known as the narrowleaf onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
